member.name: T:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1
member.summary:
BaseController(Of T); used for base of each controller in the project. This class contains a basic route named health that can be called on controller level (for external monitoring), it contains basic functionality for checking if static output is needed and it sets and gets the basic Logger and CurrentApplicationUser.
Make sure when you implement a new controller that you will add this base class.
All routes within the controllers must implement the IActionResult as output. So we can add statuses with our responses.
NOTE! all controllers must inherit from this controller and are therefor default authorized. If unauthorized access is needed add [AllowAnonymous] to the route.

member.name: P:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1.UseStaticOutput
member.summary: UseStaticOutput; calls CheckStaticOutput which checks the QueryString if static is available and true, if so returns true or false so a static string located in StaticOutput.

member.name: P:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1.CurrentApplicationUser
member.summary: CurrentApplicationUser; current application used is the user that is currently connecting with the API based on the user Token that is supplied within the headers of the call. The user contains basic information like its CompanyId. NOTE! the user is only filled when 1) the token supplied exists. 2) the right constructor is used with implementation.

member.name: P:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1.IsAppRequest
member.summary: IsAppRequest; Checks if request is a request from one of the apps.

member.name: P:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1.IsCmsRequest
member.summary: IsCmsRequest; Checks if request is a request from the cms.

member.summary: BaseController; Implementation for controllers that use a logger and application user (e.g. contain some kind of database connectivity).

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger{`0})
member.summary: BaseController; Implementation for controllers that only use the logger.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1.Get
member.summary: Base route, returns the name of the controller when its active and no other routing parameters are used.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1.CheckStaticOutput
member.summary: CheckStaticOutput; check if static output must be generated based on QueryString parameter 'static' The static output is based on strings, and only used for the development of the API, will probably be removed before release candidate is published.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1.GetObjectResultJsonWithStatus(System.Object)
member.summary: GetObjectResultWithStatus; Gets a object result based on the supplied object. Depending if object is null a certain status will be returned.
member.param: The object that needs to be checked and returned
member.returns: ObjectResult, containing a status code, and content (as JSON)

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.HealthController.GetItWorksCheck
member.summary: Default route, when working will return true.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.HealthController.GetDatabaseUpAndRunning
member.summary: GetDatabaseUpAndRunning; checks if the db is available based on a query through entity framework. When there are results the basics works as it should

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.HealthController.GetUserConnection
member.summary: GetUserConnection; checks if a prepared user can be validated through its company id, if so the db and basic authentication work based on request token header.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.HealthController.GetVersion
member.summary: GetVersion; get version of application assembly. Version: [major].[minor].[yyMM].[ddHH(mm rounded)] e.g. when it's 21th of march 2020 15:33 The minor version = 1 The major version = 2 The total version will be 2.1.2003.21153

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.HealthController.GetLogicVersions
member.summary: GetLogicVersions; Get all versions of the logic parts of the EZGO api. In normal conditions these would be the same as the API version.
member.returns: String containing all EZGO logic (dlls) with their versions.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.HealthController.GetAuthorization
member.summary: GetAuthorization; Checks Authorization, should return 401 when not supplying a bearer token.
member.returns: Returns string with Ok when authorized.

member.returns: A string containing the technical name of the current environment.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.HealthController.GetEnvironment
member.summary: GetEnvironment; Gets the current running environment (based on config)
member.returns: A string containing the technical name of the current environment.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.HealthController.GetEnvironmentVariables
member.summary: GetEnvironmentVariables; Gets the API_ENVIRONMENTAL_VARIABLES_ACTIVE variable from the environmental variables settings.
member.returns: Should return true. If not available will return false or generate an error..

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.AuthenticationController.Login(EZGO.Api.Models.Authentication.Login)
member.summary: Login; Main access route for getting acc token. NOTE! there is a specific hammer protection based on the UserName, depending on settings only a number of times within a certain time frame a login request for a specific UserName can be done.
member.param: Login object based on Login model within the API models.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.AuthenticationController.AutoLogin(System.String)
member.summary: External login; Used for getting token through a external login. Depending on the source (e.g. MSAL, Google) will be validated through several structures.
member.param: JWT token containing external information. Based on external login structure.
member.returns: Internal access token also based on JWT
